channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road Obstruction by Parking Cars, 18th November
item.description:
The road is within the Stoke Orchard Estate. There are parking cars Obstructing the road where there should be no parking cars causing safety concerns as if emergency vehicles would need to be called would not be able to access the properties. Not to mention that where the cars are parking are within 10 meters of a double junction causing other road users to go into the opposite side increasing the risk for accidents and blocking the view for other drivers. Also, blocking the houses driveway again increasing the risk for collision! There should be double yellow line on the part of the road, as well as the free parking spaces should be clearly lined out so these risks could be mitigated!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Greenwood Drive, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rattling manhole cover, 18th November
item.description:
Outside ‘Teacher’s House’ and the Old Dairy - manhole rattles with every car that passes which is particularly disturbing during the night

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe

item.title: Building work causing dangerous condition, 18th November
item.description:
A long wall is being Built along the path. The pathway is now Partially obstructed and deep in mud. Causing a potential trip hazard. I think the path has to be Temporarily Be closed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Mead Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Highways safety barriers continually collapsing and creating a hazard, 18th November
item.description:
Outside numbers 21 and 23 Beverley Gardens, the pavement was closed by GCC Highways as it was considered unsafe for pedestrians. But the barriers (each secured by just one sandbag) fall onto path and road daily creating an obstruction and hazard. Residents have tried to make them more secure but without success. The street is unlit at night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Gardens, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Pot hole previously reported 30 Oct, 18th November
item.description:
Previously reported pot hole that has been there for months, has grown in size and will continue to do so until fixed. Makes aggressively loud impact noise if hit in vehicle. Difficult to avoid if oncoming vehicle happens to be approaching the other way. Accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised pavement and uneven surface, 18th November
item.description:
This is located down an alley that is a walk way for people between Clyde Rd brockworth and Trent Rd brockworth tree roots coming up through ground and very rough pavement which is very unsafe for pedestrian especially disabled people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clyde Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 17th November
item.description:
Hi Recently tarmac work has been done on Bouncers Lane, and ever since the man hole cover outside the boundary wall of Steyne House has become loose and very noisy when cars drive over it. Please could someone look at it? Many Thanks.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 17th November
item.description:
